alert.note: Alert for Carver; McLeod; Wright (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 2:58PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Wright, northeastern McLeod and northwestern Carver Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 257 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Howard Lake, or 11 miles southwest of Buffalo, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Montrose, Winsted, Howard Lake, Waverly and Smith Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near a lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
